item.title: Borderlands 4: Bramblesong Boss Guide and Legendary Drops
item.description:
Farming bosses is a key part of Borderlands 4 , and few bosses are as annoying as Bramblesong. This giant flying boss is not only one of the most frustrating encounters in Borderlands 4 , but there's also a chance for your loot to fall off a ledge and despawn to make things even worse.

If you're not hunting for any of its dedicated legendary drops, then you can just ignore Bramblesong after you've cleared the Auger Mine that it's guarding. Some of its weapons, however, are cornerstones of specific builds. Here's how to find and farm Bramblesong in Borderlands 4 .

Borderlands 4 Bramblesong Location

Bramblesong is located in the Bittervein Auger Mine , found in the northern part of the Stoneblood Forest region of Terminus Range in Borderlands 4 . Auger Mines are unlocked after completing the Shadow of the Mountain main quest, the first story mission in Terminus Range.

Once you've made it far enough in the story, you can challenge Bramblesong at the Bittervein Auger Mine whenever you're ready. The mine is filled with flying Kratches, so bring a long-range weapon like an assault rifle or sniper to deal with them. After some parkour to climb through the mine, you'll reach Bramblesong's boss arena.

Bramblesong is a gigantic Kratch that fires corrosive acid from its tail. It won't land during the fight, so close-range weapons are ineffective. It also has two health bars, both of which are weak to fire damage. It's a straightforward duel, and there are smaller Kratches flying around the arena that you can use to pick yourself up if you go down.

Bramblesong Legendary Drops

Bramblesong has two dedicated legendary drops in Borderlands 4 .

Legendary

Description

Convergence Shotgun

Asymptotic: On hit, spawn converging projectiles on enemy.

Disco Grenade

Groove: Spins and deals AOE damage before exploding.

Convergence is one of the best legendary shotguns in Borderlands 4 , and it can roll with multiple types of elemental damage and licensed weapon parts. Because of this, it can fit into any build. The Disco grenade is also surprisingly strong. It deals repeated AOE damage while it floats through the air, making it perfect for crowd control.

If your drops fall off the ledge and despawn after fighting Bramblesong, check your Lost Loot . It can take a while for the machine to update with new gear, though.

Legendaries are exceptionally rare, so you'll have to hope you get lucky when farming Bramblesong if you want a specific roll for Convergence or Disco. Thankfully, you won't have to worry about Bramblesong after you get your desired drop. At least, not until you need to unlock Ultimate Vault Hunter 5 in Borderlands 4 .

24
8.0 /10
8 /10

Borderlands 4

item.title: Best Games That Make You Feel Like A Fish Out Of Water
item.description:
While it's always fun exploring an environment that the protagonist and the surrounding characters are already familiar with, there's something about being dropped in the middle of nowhere that can make a game even more intriguing to jump into and play. Being a fish out of water essentially means waking up in a world with essentially no knowledge of anything that's going on around you, so developers who create an experience that centers around this idea can result in the player feeling a bunch of different emotions throughout their playthrough.

While it can definitely be a little scary and even intimidating to venture through a world that is completely shrouded in mystery, it can also encourage players to be more adventurous in order to uncover everything they can to piece together the story as they go along. Anyone who enjoys the idea of feeling like they have been pushed out of their comfort zone and into an entirely new world for the very first time definitely ought to give these excellent games below a try.

Outlast

Miles Suddenly Finds Himself In An Eerie Asylum Full Of Brutish Inmates

Outlast
8.0 /10
Released
November 4, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
Mature // Intense Violence, Blood and Gore, Sexual Content, Nudity, Strong Language
Developer(s)
Red Barrels
Publisher(s)
Red Barrels
Engine
Unreal Engine 3
Powered by

When protagonist Miles rocks up to the Mount Massive Asylum at the beginning of Outlast , he is led to believe that the enormous building is mostly abandoned, but the truth is, he couldn't have been more wrong. While players are free to explore a few rooms at the beginning of the game, they are then abruptly thrown into a cell with nothing but a camera and a handful of batteries to keep them going. For the majority of Outlast , players will desperately be trying to navigate their way through the asylum while avoiding all the crazed inmates to finally return home, but considering they have no weapons to speak of, getting caught while running around is more or less inevitable.

What amplifies the tension is the fact that the brutish inmates who occupy the building know the asylum like the back of their hands and are able to sprint through all kinds of secret passageways to catch players off guard when they least expect it. Therefore, while surviving against enemies and scavenging as many batteries as possible at the core of the gameplay loop, another major aspect of Outlast is learning the layout of the environment to avoid running into a Game Over screen too often after being caught.

Fallout 3

Once That Vault Door Opens, The World Becomes A Mystery

Fallout 3
18
8.7 /10
Released
October 28, 2008

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Vault 101 may seem like a very comfy and cozy area to start off in at the beginning of Fallout 3, but it's not long before players will be forced to flee the safe haven, leading them to the apocalyptic surface. As soon as players open up the Vault Gate, they will find themselves all alone in a world that has been completely decimated by nuclear warfare. This is ultimately what makes exploring in Fallout 3 so exciting, since there's no telling what sort of humans, Ghouls, or monsters will be showing up around each corner, and whether they will be friend or foe.

Considering the player's character will have grown up in the confines of the Vault, they will also have no knowledge of the culture and traditions that can be uncovered while traveling along the surface. This helps to make the world of Fallout 3 believable and realistic, allowing players to feel truly immersed in the experience by learning how the world operates now that it has been turned into a post-apocalyptic wasteland.

Far Cry 5

Players Find Themselves Traversing Through A Land Ruled By Joseph Seeds' Goons

Far Cry 5
9 /10
22
7.9 /10
Released
March 27, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
Powered by

At the beginning of Far Cry 5 , the mission is simply to apprehend a dangerous cult member known as Joseph Seed, but to say things ended up going horribly wrong would be an understatement. With most of their allies killed and no way of escaping Hope County, players find themselves surrounded by Joseph Seed and his devoted loyal soldiers, who will be hunting them down every step of the way. Much like previous Far Cry games, Far Cry 5 is all about players acquiring weapons, gadgets, and items throughout their journey to eventually go from the hunted to a hunter, though getting to this point is far from easy.

Hope County, which is the open world that players are free to explore, is separated into three major areas, each controlled by one of Joseph's subordinates. Each environment has a very distinct and unique aesthetic which feeds into the subordinate's personality and backstory, and while these individuals will have full control over their respective territory, it's up to the player to rebel by taking down enemy camps and removing their influence, resulting in a fun and addictive gameplay loop which just never gets old.

Resident Evil 7

Ethan Definitely Didn't Plan To Spend The Night In The Baker's Creepy Mansion

Resident Evil 7: Biohazard
13
8.9 /10
Released
January 24, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Strong Language
Powered by

While most of the Resident Evil games involve a character entering a mysterious area that is crawling with zombies and B.O.W.s, they will at least have some kind of combat and firearm experience to ensure they don't get eaten alive right away. In the case of Ethan, the main protagonist of Resident Evil 7 , he is tasked with rescuing his wife, Mia, from a giant estate owned by the Bakers, a corrupted family who can't be taken down with a few handgun bullets or a shotgun blast.

Since Ethan is designed to be an ordinary civilian who has barely ever used a gun in his life, Resident Evil 7 does a good job of making players feel like they are severely underprepared for the journey ahead of them. It invokes the sense of being somewhere that you really shouldn't be, amplifying the dread and horror in the process. While characters like Leon and Chris may be more than prepared to take down any mutant who gets in their way, the same certainly can't be said for Ethan, who is much more of a fish out of water compared to those two protagonists.

BioShock Infinite

The Awe-Inspiring Columbia Isn't Quite What It Seems On The Surface

BioShock Infinite
10 /10
12
9.1 /10
Released
March 26, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Mild Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco
Powered by

When Booker DeWitt is introduced to the player in BioShock Infinite , he comes across as a smart-mouthed and cocky mercenary who is probably a little too confident for his own good. His demeanor completely changes, though, once he is randomly shot up into the sky and arrives in the floating city of Columbia. Though it is completely separated from the regular world, Columbia is a place that still has its own traditions, norms, and culture. As is made evident in the first hour of the game, where players stumble their way through a bizarre carnival which eventually gets them into trouble, Columbia is a place where those who are unfamiliar with the rules and laws will immediately be picked out by the population, and will inevitably be seen as an enemy.

However, Booker doesn't have any time to familiarize himself with the city, as he is instead on a desperate mission to rescue Elizabeth, who has been locked away in a tower for much of her life. It's an absolute blast being able to navigate through Columbia by using the Skyrails to jump between areas, and it's exciting to see the monsters and machines that the residents of Colombia have created to deal with anyone who dares to trespass on their city.

Metro Exodus

The Surface World Has New Masters Now

Metro Exodus
8.6 /10
Released
February 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ due to Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

In most of the Metro games, players will spend the majority of their time traveling through the dark and murky underground, only to pop up on the radiated surface every now and again for supplies. In Metro Exodus , though, the survivors have finally managed to reach the surface without being killed straight away, giving players the freedom to explore iconic locales that have been completely taken over by mutants and beasts. As a result, while there may be a few familiar landmarks to keep an eye out for, players must always remember that this land has long been ruled by the monsters that occupy it, rather than the humans.

While it's important to explore each area as thoroughly as possible to acquire supplies needed for survival, doing so is never easy, considering most enemies will be more than happy to hunt down the player as soon as they lay eyes on them. Because a mutant may be more than familiar with the lay of the land, considering they've been wandering around the surface for so long, players must use their intuition and resources to figure out where to go next without being mauled by a pack of beasts along the way, ensuring the gameplay remains tense and immersive from beginning to end.

No Man's Sky

A Vast Set Of Galaxies That All Contains Unique Planets, Stars, And Creatures

No Man's Sky
7 /10
69
9.3 /10
Released
August 9, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Fantasy Violence, Animated Blood
Powered by

No Man's Sky is an absolutely massive game, to the point where many claim it to be the biggest open-world game ever made, considering there are essentially an unlimited number of planets that players can visit. When taking all of this into account, it can admittedly be a little easy to feel overwhelmed when starting off the game, but to be honest, that is ultimately what the developers are going for. No Man's Sky is all about uncovering new and unique planets, which are all packed full of their own set of resources, wildlife, and landmarks to discover.

When taking a look at the massive scale of the galaxy map, it really puts into perspective just how minuscule the player is compared to the world around them, making them feel like just one part of a much larger game. This is why it's all so satisfying to venture across a mysterious planet and eventually turn it into a base, as it allows players to feel like they've conquered a brand-new area through their own curiosity, but it goes without saying that one planet is just a fraction of what players can run into along their grand space adventure.

item.title: Game Characters Who Are Too Into Themselves
item.description:
Ever meet a character in a video game who is so hateable that it’s hard to resist the urge to slap the TV? Hope from Final Fantasy 13 , for example, likes to wine a lot, and Abby from The Last of Us Part 2 did so many horrible things. These characters can make players irritated, but then there are the characters who are so self-absorbed that they see themselves as gods lording over swine.

It may be their looks, powers, intelligence, or all of the above. These character types don’t just need a slap; they need a wedgie to come down from their high and mighty attitudes. These game characters are too into themselves and need a wake-up call, if they didn’t get one in their respective games already.

The entries for BioShock and Ratchet & Clank will contain spoilers.

Bowser (Super Mario RPG: Legend Of The Seven Stars)

The King Of All Koopas

Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars
9.0 /10
Released
May 13, 1996

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone
Powered by

The Mario series is full of weird enemies, but topping them all is Mario’s main baddie, Bowser . He comes to life in the SNES classic, Super Mario RPG: Legend of the Seven Stars , wherein he loses his castle to another villain and is forced to join up with Mario.

Even though he should be grateful for the help in getting his castle back, he can’t miss an opportunity to brag about how he’s the best or that he’s the hero of the story and not Mario. It’s a tough guy persona that he seemingly needs to maintain just to make himself feel better, and he does this in both versions of the game, including the more easily accessible remake on Switch.

Handsome Jack (Borderlands 2)

Never Stops Talking

Borderlands 2
8 /10
15
8.9 /10
Released
September 18, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Handsome Jack is the main antagonist of Borderlands 2 and the president of the gun manufacturer Hyperion. Jack has lofty goals and isn’t satisfied with profits from selling weaponry; he wants the treasures and powers found only in Vaults. That’s why he’s constantly calling and chastising players for getting in the way of his plans.

He never misses an opportunity to brag about his looks, his powers as an executive, or how much cooler he is as a hero, which players can experience in a prequel, Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel . His character also gets some additional groan-worthy development in Telltale's Tales from the Borderlands.

Hojo (Final Fantasy 7)

He Never Asked If He Should

Final Fantasy 7
21
8.8 /10
Released
January 31, 1997

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Fantasy Violence, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes
Powered by

Final Fantasy 7 is full of antagonists, more so than any other Final Fantasy game. Sephiroth ranks up there as number one since he is the main villain, but below him is the twisted Shinra scientist with no soul, Hojo .

Even though he works for Shinra, Hojo doesn’t care about their goals because his ambitions are all about spitting in the face of god. He feels as though he was put on Earth to experiment on everything and everyone because he’s a genius. Hojo feels for no one, not even himself, but he sure does think he's special.

Ichiryusai Madarame (Persona 5)

Plagiarizes Children's Art

Persona 5
11
8.1 /10
Released
September 15, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Drug Reference, Partial Nudity, Sexual Themes, Strong Language, Violence
Powered by

Persona 5 ultimately boils down to an RPG about a group of teen thieves trying to change the hearts of corrupted adults by infiltrating their "Mind Palaces," akin to the mind games in Inception . One such dishonorable adult is Ichiryusai Madarame , a renowned painter across Japan who holds himself in very high esteem.

The cruel thing is, he plagiarizes the works of his students to get ahead and somehow manipulates them into thinking this is right because of how great he is as a "mentor." This leads to a big revelation in the game, which doesn’t need to be spoiled here. Suffice it to say Madarame is a narcissist through and through.

Andrew Ryan (BioShock)

Would You Kindly?

BioShock
15
9.5 /10
Released
August 21, 2007

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

Andrew Ryan is established early on in BioShock as the designer of Rapture, a vast underwater city. Built as a paradise, Ryan finds himself acting as a powerful god for what he accomplished, but he wants to come across as a gentle soul, even though his words are manipulative.

They’re quite literally manipulative because he pushes the protagonist to do his bidding by using code words, which is the big revelation in the game climax. Ryan then somehow becomes a godlike entity, like he dreamed of, by the end, before players can end his obsessive rule over the husk of Rapture.

Captain Qwark (Ratchet & Clank)

Never Meet Your Heroes

Ratchet & Clank
Third-Person Shooter
Platformer
Systems
8.0 /10
Released
November 6, 2002
ESRB
Teen // Mild Violence

Powered by

Ratchet & Clank is the first game in the series, with Ratchet starting out as a mechanic who dreams of becoming a hero like Captain Qwark. Qwark is designed to be like the big-chinned heroes who can do no wrong, the kind found in radio dramas dating as far back as the 1940s.

He’s a hero to the galaxy, but the twist is that Qwark is a bit washed up, and to maintain his image, he works with villains or does nefarious things to set up chaotic situations, only to then jump in and save the day. It’s a big letdown for Ratchet, who looked up to him, but the good news is that the Qwark's vanity gradually declines in the Ratchet & Clank series over time.

Prince Laharl (Disgaea: Hour Of Darkness)

A Fight For The Throne

Disgaea: Hour of Darkness
Tactical
Strategy
RPG
Systems
Released
August 27, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
t
Powered by

Prince Laharl is the protagonist of Disgaea: Hour of Darkness , one of the wildest PS2 tactical RPGs of all time. After his father dies, Laharl takes over the throne, but he’s not ready for it. Laharl is not disciplined enough to know how to rule benevolently, instead thinking that his lineage gives him the right to rule no matter what.

This leads to a people's revolution, as Laharl's citizens want to usurp the throne. The whole game is a lesson for Laharl on how to become a better ruler and person in the underworld.

Disco Kid (Punch-Out)

A Bad Sport For Looking Good

Punch-Out!!
Fighting
Action
Systems
Released
May 18, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
e
Powered by

Disco Kid is one of the rival boxers in the 2009 Punch-Out!! game that was released on the Wii. There’s no more prime example of a character who is painfully into himself than Disco Kid, as his looks are all that's important to his character.

He will even pause during a boxing match to look at himself in the mirror, confident that his boxing skills are so good that he doesn’t need to fully pay attention. It’s odd that a pretty boy like Disco Kid would want to be in a boxing match in the first place, since his face means everything to him.

item.title: Amazon Is Making Major Changes to Prime Gaming
item.description:
Amazon has revealed that it's discontinuing the Prime Gaming brand in a message to Amazon Prime subscribers. However, users shouldn't panic, as the change won't have as big an impact on Amazon Prime Gaming subscribers as one might initially expect.

As Amazon owns livestreaming service Twitch, it has historically provided benefits to Amazon Prime subscribers for the service. Those who enjoy included services like free shipping on Amazon via Amazon Prime can also take advantage of the service to subscribe to one Twitch channel for free every month. This confers the usual benefits to the chosen streamer without taking any extra money out of the subscriber's pocket. Amazon Prime Gaming also gives subscribers access to free games monthly.

Amazon Reveals Change to Prime Gaming

In a new release to subscribers, Amazon has revealed that the Prime Gaming brand is being retired, but that users' benefits won't be negatively impacted. According to Amazon, subscribers to the Prime service will still enjoy the same benefits they've come to expect, but it will now be incorporated into Amazon Luna, the company's cloud gaming service. Amazon reassured subscribers that users will still be able to receive one Twitch subscription per month, plus expanded emote sets, chat colors, and extended broadcast storage as they've come to expect on Twitch under Amazon Prime Gaming, with no significant differences made to how one can redeem these options. Additionally, free games will still be provided to subscribers on a monthly basis.

This change may seem familiar to long-time subscribers of Amazon Prime who have been enjoying the Twitch benefits that it confers. Back in 2020, the service underwent a similar experience, shifting from what was then referred to as Twitch Prime to the new name Amazon Prime Gaming. At the time, aside from changing the name, the main alteration was that Amazon Prime subscribers could use their benefits on Twitch without subscribing directly to the livestreaming service, by using their Amazon accounts instead. Like in that case, chances are established users won't experience any significant frustrations with this alteration.

Amazon has made significant changes to its Prime subscription over the years, adding and removing features and benefits for subscribers as it sees fit. Cutting the Twitch benefits would likely negatively impact a considerable number of streamers, so it seems unlikely that Amazon will make a change to this feature anytime soon, especially as other livestreaming platforms like Kick try to entice livestreamers to use its service instead of Amazon's.

item.title: Where to Place Deluxe Edition Traveler's Maps in Ghost of Yotei
item.description:
The deluxe edition of Ghost of Yotei includes a number of useful items that can help players get off to the best possible start. This includes early access to three special Traveler's Maps (or Traveller's Maps, if you're British), which can help guide Atsu to special locations where she can unlock new skills and abilities.

However, before players can make use of the deluxe edition Traveler's Maps, they'll first need to place them on the full map of Ezo, which can be fairly tricky while it's still covered in fog. This guide will explain where Ghost of Yotei players will need to place the deluxe edition Traveler's Maps and the rewards that they can find by following them.

Where to Place the Cave Altar Traveler's Map

The Cave Altar Traveler's Map will need to be placed on a fork in the Sarubetsu River just to the north of the Windy Meadow. If players head to the location marked on the map, they'll find an Altar of Reflection, which players can pray at to earn a skill point.

Where to Place the Overlook Altar Traveler's Map

Players can place the Overlook Altar Traveler's Map on the southern edge of the mountain range in the northern part of Ezo, just above the Serpent's Pass. Heading to the location shown on the map will reveal another Altar of Reflection and another skill point for Atsu.

Where to Place the Waterfall Altar Traveler's Map

The Waterfall Altar Traveler's Map must be placed in Shirahige Falls, which is near the southern coast of Ezo, to the east of Lake Kuttara. As with the other two Ghost of Yotei deluxe edition Traveler's Maps, it will guide players to an Altar of Reflection at which Atsu can pray.
